m_szDocSumamry: New Kind of 40% Efficient Solar Farm Gets $90 Million DOE Loan Guarantee to Cogentrix September 21st, 2011 by Susan Kraemer     The largest High Concentration Photovoltaic (HCPV) project in the world is being funded by the DOE with a $90 million loan guarantee for the Cogentrix  Alamosa Solar Generating Project. The first 20 years of the electricity it will generate has already been bought under a PPA (power purchase agreement) by the Public Service Company of Colorado. More than 80 percent of its components will be sourced from the United States.
